snippet: Japan’s economy has posted a robust growth rate, but economists said Europe, particularly Germany under Chancellor Angela Merkel, was not willing to learn from Tokyo.
abstract: News analysis; Japan posts unexpectedly robust growth rate of 3.5 percent under new stimulus measures championed by Prime Min Shinzo Abe; measures, like expansionary monetary policy and increased fiscal spending, stand in contrast to austerity practices followed by Europe, which continues to fall into longest recession since World War II.
lead_paragraph: Japan’s economy has posted a robust growth rate, but economists said Europe, particularly Germany under Chancellor Angela Merkel, was not willing to learn from Tokyo.

headline.seo: Japan Courts Growth While Europe Keeps Up Austerity
headline.main: As Japan Courts Growth, Europe Keeps Up Its Love Affair With Austerity
headline.print_headline: As Japan Courts Growth, Europe Keeps Up Its Love Affair With Austerity
